This step you only need to do once per webviz application (updating an existing application is easy - see next step)
An Azure web app is an easy way of getting an application hosted on Azure. As default you will get an URL of the format http://some_name_you_choose.azurewebsites.net.
  1. Go to Azure Portal and sign in.
  2. Select Create a resource > Web > Web App for Containers.
  3. Choose a name for your new web app.
  4. Select the Subscription you have access too.
  5. Select the Resource Group appropriate for the application.
  6. Choose Linux as OS.
  7. For App Service Plan choose one of the existing ones, or create a new one.
  8. Click on Configure container, and choose Docker compose (preview) in the panel that appears.
  9. Choose Azure container registry when it comes to Image source.
With the configuration panel, copy and paste the following configuration: 
version: '3'
services:
  web:
    image: ACRNAME.azurecr.io/webviz_PROJECTNAME:latest
    cap_drop:
     - all
    ports:
     - 80:5000

where you replace ACRNAME with the name you chose for your Azure container registry.

You should also replace PROJECTNAME with a name relevant for the webviz instace you will deploy, e.g. the name of your field. This name will be used later when deploying the actual webviz instance.

Choose On with respect to Continuous Deployment. This will make sure that your web application automatically updates when your webvist instance updates.

Click on Save when done.

Source: Azure web abb using Python - get started
